name: 2013_11_humanities_student_major_502_bartenders
title: 2013-11-humanities-student-major_502_bartenders.txt
content_scrubbed:
Let[.] just take a quick aside here and focus not on the bosses, but on the girl who wrote this blog.

Liberal arts degree and she[.] surprised she has to wait tables? Come on sweetheart, I'm 4 months from getting a double major in physics and astronomy with honors and I doubt I'll be able to find a career job RIGHT AWAY, if ever. A degree doesn't guarantee you a job, that[.] a reality that a lot of kids these days don't seem to grasp. This probably sounds pessimistic and bitter, but undergrad degrees, especially those in arts are pretty much on par with what a high school degree was 30 years ago - everyone has one. 
For me, if I don't land a job as a research assistant right off the bat and work my way up the ladder, I can either teach highschool or go to Graduate School so I can get a better job, not ideal but that[.] just the way the world works.

Second, this is clearly her first job. Shocker that there are mean scary people out there beyond the sacred hallowed halls of knowledge and higher learning. Everywhere you work there are going to be assholes and bigots, from construction to academia and everywhere in between you're going to run into someone who works above you that you would love to waterboard for one reason or the other. 

The level of self righteousness in this paper made me sick, sort of fitting though for a girl who spent at least 4 years of her life in Montreal though. 

/rant

Exuent
